snippet: Lt. Gov. Kim Guadagno pushed back against an accusation that she had threatened to deny Hurricane Sandy relief to Hoboken, N.J., if the city’s mayor, Dawn Zimmer, failed to support a redevelopment project.
abstract: New Jersey Lt Gov Kim Guadagno pushes back against an accusation that she had threatened to deny Hurricane Sandy relief to city of Hoboken if Mayor Dawn Zimmer, failed to support a redevelopment project; says allegation is false and illogical and does not stand up under scrutiny of facts; Zimmer claims that Guadagno told her that Gov Chris Christie had sent her to deliver that message personally.

byline.contributor: Alan Feuer contributed reporting from New York, and Kate Zernike from New Jersey.

lead_paragraph: Lt. Gov. Kim Guadagno pushed back against an accusation that she had threatened to deny Hurricane Sandy relief to Hoboken, N.J., if the city’s mayor, Dawn Zimmer, failed to support a redevelopment project.

headline.main: Lieutenant Governor Calls Hoboken Mayor’s Claims ‘Illogical’
headline.print_headline: Lieutenant Governor Calls a Mayor’s Claims ‘Illogical’
